conclusion: Need to find the force exerted by the small ball on the light rod at the highest point P with the slider locked.
Slider with mass M = 2 kg is locked on a smooth horizontal track, with a light rod of length L = 0.5 m rotating around a smooth axis O.
A small ball of mass m = 1 kg is at one end of the rod, initially horizontal, with an upward velocity v₀ = 4 m/s, and gravity g = 10 m/s².
Focus on the motion of the ball and rod without considering slider movement.
Ball moves in a circular path around point O; need to find force exerted by rod on ball at highest point P.
At highest point, forces on ball are weight (mg downward) and force by rod (upward or downward).
Net force at highest point provides centripetal force for circular motion.
Net force F_net is F + mg, equaling m times centripetal acceleration mv²/L.
Need velocity at point P; use conservation of energy due to vertical motion and height change.
Initial kinetic energy: (1/2)mv₀²; gravitational potential energy: mgL.
At point P, kinetic energy: (1/2)mv²; gravitational potential energy: mg(2L).
Set initial and point P mechanical energies equal: (1/2)mv₀² + mgL = (1/2)mv² + mg(2L).
Plug in values: m = 1 kg, L = 0.5 m, v₀ = 4 m/s, g = 10 m/s².
Solve: 13 = 0.5v² + 10; v² = 6; v = sqrt(6) m/s ≈ 2.449 m/s.
Find centripetal force: F_centripetal = mv²/L = (1 kg)(6 m²/s²)/(0.5 m) = 12 N.
At point P, forces on ball are weight mg downward and force by rod F.
If rod provides downward force, net force F + mg equals F_centripetal.
